lyrics.text: First listen and then answer the question.
lyrics.translation: 首先听录音，然后回答问题。

lyrics.text: Why did the policeman ask the writer to come to the police station?
lyrics.translation: 警察为什么要求作家去警察局？

lyrics.text: It must have been about two in the morning when I returned home.
lyrics.translation: 我回到家时，一定是凌晨两点左右。

lyrics.text: I tried to wake up my wife by ringing the doorbell, but she was fast asleep.
lyrics.translation: 我试图通过按门铃来叫醒我的妻子，但她睡得很熟。

lyrics.text: So I got a ladder from the shed in the garden, put it against the wall, and began climbing towards the bedroom window.
lyrics.translation: 于是我从花园的小屋里拿了一架梯子，把它靠在墙上，开始向卧室窗户爬去。

lyrics.text: I was almost there when a sarcastic voice below said,
lyrics.translation: 我几乎到了那里，下面一个讽刺的声音说，

lyrics.text: I don't think the windows need cleaning at this time of the night.
lyrics.translation: 我认为在这个时候，窗户不需要清洁。

lyrics.text: I looked down and nearly fell off the ladder when I saw a policeman.
lyrics.translation: 我低头一看，差点从梯子上掉下来，因为我看到了一个警察。

lyrics.text: I immediately regretted answering in the way I did, but I said,
lyrics.translation: 我立刻后悔以我的方式回答，但我说，

lyrics.text: I enjoy cleaning windows at night.
lyrics.translation: 我享受在夜晚清洁窗户。

lyrics.text: So do I, answered the policeman in the same tone.
lyrics.translation: “我也是，”警察用同样的语气回答道。

lyrics.text: I hate to interrupt a man when he's busy working, but would you mind coming with me to the station?
lyrics.translation: 我讨厌在一个人忙于工作时打扰他，但你介意和我一起去车站吗？

lyrics.text: Well, I'd prefer to stay here, I said.
lyrics.translation: 嗯，我宁愿待在这里，我说。

lyrics.text: You see, I've forgotten my key.
Fortunately, the shouting woke up my wife, who opened the window just as the policeman had started to climb towards me.
lyrics.translation: 幸运的是，喊叫声惊醒了我的妻子，她打开窗户的时候，警察已经开始向我爬来。
